ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This class had lots of discussion, so the quality of the course is heavily dependent on the interests of the students taking it. This semester there were many interested students, so the conversation was lively.
The opportunity to talk about interesting issues in biology and think about intellectually challenging issues.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The professor is clearly extremely knowledgable about the subjects addressed but needs to structure the class more soundly in order to actually convey his knowledge in a helpful manner. The lectures were scattered and sometimes repetitive. Most of the slides were examples of general theory that was often not clearly addressed. The stories being told were very cool, but how to harness that knowledge to do better work on our own was unclear.For most students at this level, much of the material was also repetitive of earlier classes. Either more in-depth theory or, at the very least, more complicated analysis of primary literature on the material would make the class more engaging.I believe the course would also benefit from more work--perhaps a midterm as well as a final, or a paper and a takehome.
Wasn't very much work. Assigned readings would add to the course without making it too difficult.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: For students interested in biology, this course is great and lets us discuss big ideas. Given the lack of courses for students with a focus on conservation and animals, this is one of few courses available.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I like thinking about "big ideas" in biology, plus it's helpful for having an intellectual understanding of conservation issues.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
Did you get out of it what you expected?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Make sure to ask questions and be thinking about these issues. We had really interesting discussions when we paused or went back to issues. The professor obviously loves talking about the subject, so you just have to get him started.
